alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jackson; Madison; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 6:30PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Oconee, Clarke, southeastern Jackson, northwestern Oglethorpe and Madison Counties through 700 PM EST... At 630 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Ila to James Holland Youth Sports Cmpx to North High Shoals, and moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Watkinsville, Danielsville, Lexington, Athens, Nicholson, Comer, Winterville, Crawford, North High Shoals, Colbert, Arnoldsville, Ila, Carlton, Bishop, Hull, Whitehall, Athens-Clarke County, Westgate Park, Diamond Hill and Smithonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for north central and northeastern Georgia.
